summary: The Operational Security Act of 2025 proposes to establish an Office of Security Training and Counterintelligence within the Executive Office of the President. The office will be responsible for providing security training, addressing counterintelligence and insider threats, and protecting classified information.  A Director, appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, will head the office. The bill also establishes a Security Training and Counterintelligence Advisory Board comprised of security experts from both parties in Congress to advise on best practices.
